[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Unified University Inventory System (UUIS) defines requirements to improve inventory management, streamline asset tracking, and ensure compliance with university policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: UUIS supports asset tracking, access control, request approvals, and reporting for faculty, staff, and students.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: UUIS integrates with authentication services, legacy inventory databases, and email servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: UUIS provides web-based dashboards for administrators and authorized users.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: UUIS operates on desktops, mobile devices, and cloud servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: UUIS supports REST APIs for third-party system integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: UUIS uses secure protocols for encrypted data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: UUIS optimizes memory for large inventories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: UUIS ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: UUIS adapts to faculty-specific configurations and access policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: UUIS connects to auditing and reporting platforms for compliance tracking.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: UUIS supports asset management, permissions, requests, and compliance tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for university administrators, faculty, and students with basic IT knowledge.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: UUIS depends on stable network connectivity and integration with existing authentication systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: UUIS requires operational authentication services and compliance with university IT policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with LDAP for secure authentication.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with email servers for request notifications and approval workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable users to create, approve, and track asset transfer requests (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow administrators to assign and revoke inventory permissions based on user roles (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive user interface with guided workflows.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The interface shall support multilingual functionality for diverse user groups.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process asset requests within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 1,000 concurrent users during peak load.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store asset data, user roles, and permission records.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time updates and role-based access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular design principles for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with university security and IT policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 27001 security standards and comply with GDPR requirements for user data privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on asset volume and user demand.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all inventory operations for audit compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional testing validates asset management workflows, performance benchmarks, and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Setup guides, user manuals, and developer documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: University IT policy documents, ISO 27001, and GDPR guidelines.
